intro: Pachylophus nuttallii, commonly known as the Nuttall's pachylophus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the Pacific Northwest. Its botanical features include a slender stem and an umbellate inflorescence, which is typical of the family. It serves as a host plant for certain Lepidoptera species and is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
